nagaraka： nagaraka（na）
နဂရက（န）
[yadicchā]
[ယဒိစ္ဆာနာမ်]
Nagaraka，（nt．） a small city D．I，146=169，quoted J．I，391．（Page 345）

Nagaraka：A Sākiyan township near Medatalumpa．

From there Pasenadi，accompanied byDigha-Kārāyana，paid his last visit to the Buddha，as recorded in theDhammacetiya Sutta．M．ii．118．

The Buddha evidently once stayed in Nagaraka，for in the Cūla-Suññatā Sutta，Ananda is reported as reminding the Buddha that once，while staying at Nagaraka，the Buddha had remarked that he lived “with the Void a great deal．”

nagaraka：နဂရက（န）
[ယဒိစ္ဆာနာမ်]
နဂရတ-အမည်ရှိသော နိဂုံး။

nagaraka：နဂရ-က （န）
မြို့ငယ်။
